result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon J. Naniot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs--workout payment plan with agent
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
No contact with R.L.
No contact with anyone known to use, possess, or sell illegal drugs

Def must submit DNA sample on 12-06-16
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
Pay all Court ordered financial obligations and DOC supervision fees

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Landon J. Naniot

Defendant Landon J. Naniot in court with attorney Michael Gerald Perry.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:57pm
Court spks on charges and penalties
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms 
Court spks on letters received on behalf of def
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Perry spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP and SAP.
3 years probation:
6 months jail with huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. Report to jail by 7pm on 12-6-16.
Pay costs, $80 buy money, and $118 SF--workout payment plan with agent
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with Richard Lepkowski
No contact with anyone known to use, possess, or sell illegal drugs
Submit DNA sample on 12-6-16
Pay all Court ordered financial obligations and DOC supervision fees
Appeal rights
